channel.title: 562 client wont load
channel.description:
before i get flamed i am new and trying to learn this stuff so i may not quite understand everything yall expect me to know but keep in mind i really want to learn to code java so i am trying i best to understand and learn what i dont understand.
i dled project awesomeness because what i decedent i wanted to try to make is a oldschool (late 2007) source with the cool new 562+ gfx. I dont know how hard this project will be or how much i will learn while doing it but i am having troubles even getting started. All of the clients/ sources i dl are not working or not even close to what i am looking for and i think this one may work when i get it going. what happens is i run source than rune the client and the client pops up loading bar says "server is offline if suck here". i searched that in the files and also searched sj5connect in the files and found the spot in the coding where it says that but i am not sure what to change with it.
this is what comes up in the source prompt (im kinda guessing what it is called cause it makes me think of cmp prompt) [code=javascript][2013/12/13 12:52:16] [Project Awesomness 562]: rs2hd framework [2013/12/13 12:52:16] [Project Awesomness 562]: Loading Clans... [2013/12/13 12:52:16] [Project Awesomness 562]: Loaded 11 clans. [2013/12/13 12:52:16] [Project Awesomness 562]: Loaded 15500item prices. [ loaded shops ] [2013/12/13 12:52:17] [Project Awesomness 562]: Reading mapdata... [2013/12/13 12:52:17] [Project Awesomness 562]: Loaded mapdata. sorry again guys if this is an easy fix and im just too new to get it but i spent about an hours looking threw files and i feel like that is too long to spend just trying to get the client to finish loading lol.

item.title: 562 client wont load
item.dc:creator: @trilogy-reborn trilogy-reborn
item.description:
@trilogy-reborn wrote:

okay thank you for being very specific… im going to try to do that right now and i will repost what happens but with my lack in knowledge about coding it is very helpful your explaining things very well… no although you are telling me what to do to fix it; i am also in the learning process still i should say soo if you could sorta explain what the xstream is/does just so i know for future reference that would be awesome… if you cant explain it i will do some research and learn about it myself here in a bit.
-thanks

okay thank you for being very specific… im going to try to do that right now and i will repost what happens but with my lack in knowledge about coding it is very helpful your explaining things very well… no although you are telling me what to do to fix it; i am also in the learning process still i should say soo if you could sorta explain what the xstream is/does just so i know for future reference that would be awesome… if you cant explain it i will do some research and learn about it myself here in a bit.
-thanks

edit: okay i just deleted the xstream.1.3.1 and replaced it with xstream.1.4.2 which are both are executable jar files in the deps folder(in source) and tried to compile and these errors came up:

Preparing... A subdirectory or file bin already exists. The system cannot find the file specified. The system cannot find the file specified. item.title: 562 client wont load
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

No no, I mean download the updated xstream jar here:
http://grepcode.com/snapshot/repo1.maven.org/maven2/com.thoughtworks.xstream/xstream/1.4.2

If using an IDE (ex. Eclipse) right click on the project, hit properties. It should then pop up a interface, hit Java Build Path. Then hit add external jars, then go to where you put the xstream jar, and hit ‘Ok’.

If not an IDE: in the source file, you should find: data or a lib folder, go in there and just copy and past that file in there.

Edit: Oh yea, on both, make sure you delete the old xstream, and then add the new one with the directions above.
Sorry if I didn’t make myself clear my first post.

Read full topic

item.title: 562 client wont load
item.dc:creator: @trilogy-reborn trilogy-reborn
item.description:
@trilogy-reborn wrote:

Bl3nd:

You may have to update the xstream if you havn’t yet (for source). And for the Client, the source needs to be completely running, like without errors while loading.

I searched source files for “xstream” and found two files…
First is called “xstreamutil” and this is the coding inside:

[code=javascript]package com.rs2hd.util;

import com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream;

/**

  • Util class to get the xstream object.
  • @author Graham

*/
public class XStreamUtil {

private XStreamUtil() {}

private static XStream xstream = null;

public static XStream getXStream() {
	if(xstream == null) {
		xstream = new XStream();
		/*
		 * Set up our aliases.
		 */
		xstream.alias("player", com.rs2hd.model.Player.class);
		xstream.alias("itemDefinition", com.rs2hd.model.ItemDefinition.class);
		xstream.alias("item", com.rs2hd.model.Item.class);
		xstream.alias("npcDefinition", com.rs2hd.model.NPCDefinition.class);
		xstream.alias("npc", com.rs2hd.model.NPC.class);
		xstream.alias("npcDrop", com.rs2hd.model.NPCDrop.class);
		xstream.alias("drop", com.rs2hd.model.NPCDrop.Drop.class);
		xstream.alias("spawn", com.rs2hd.model.Spawn.class);
		xstream.alias("config", com.rs2hd.Configuration.class);
		xstream.alias("objects", com.rs2hd.model.GlobalObject.class);
		xstream.alias("doorHandler", com.rs2hd.content.DoorHandler.class);
	}
	return xstream;
}

}
[/code]

the second is called “xstreamplayerloader” and this is the code inside it:

[code=javascript]package com.rs2hd.io;

import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;

import com.rs2hd.Constants;
import com.rs2hd.model.Player;
import com.rs2hd.model.PlayerDetails;
import com.rs2hd.model.World;
import com.rs2hd.util.XStreamUtil;
import com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream;
import org.apache.mina.common.IoSession;
import com.rs2hd.model.PunishHandler;
import com.rs2hd.Main;
import java.util.*;

/**

  • XML player loader/saver.
  • @author Graham

*/
public class XStreamPlayerLoader implements PlayerLoader {

public static PunishHandler punish = new PunishHandler();

@Override
public PlayerLoadResult load(PlayerDetails p) 
{
	XStream xstream = XStreamUtil.getXStream();
	PlayerLoadResult result = new PlayerLoadResult();
	result.returnCode = Constants.ReturnCodes.INVALID_PASSWORD;
	try 
	{
		Player player = (Player) xstream.fromXML(new FileInputStream("data/savedgames/"+p.getUsername()+".xml"));
		player.getPlayerDetails().setSession(p.getSession());
		if(punish.isMuted(player.getUsername()))
			player.muted = true;
		if(punish.isIpMuted(player.getSession()))
			punish.writeTo(player.getUsername(), "data/text/mutes");
		if(punish.isIpBanned(player.getSession()))
			punish.writeTo(player.getUsername(), "data/text/bans");
			result.returnCode = Constants.ReturnCodes.BANNED;
		if(punish.isBanned(player.getUsername()))
			result.returnCode = Constants.ReturnCodes.BANNED;
		else 
		{
			if(!player.getPlayerDetails().getPassword().equals(p.getPassword()))
				result.returnCode = Constants.ReturnCodes.INVALID_PASSWORD;
			else 
			{
				if(World.getInstance().isOnline(p.getUsername())) {
					result.returnCode = Constants.ReturnCodes.ALREADY_ONLINE;
				}
				else 
				{
					result.player = player;
					result.returnCode = Constants.ReturnCodes.LOGIN_OK;
					//Main.frame.updateList();
				}
			}
		}
	} 
	catch (FileNotFoundException e) 
	{
		result.returnCode = Constants.ReturnCodes.LOGIN_OK;
		result.player = new Player(p);
		result.player = (Player) result.player.readResolve();
	}
	return result;
}

@Override
public boolean save(Player p) {
	boolean flag = true;
	try {
		XStream xstream = XStreamUtil.getXStream();
		xstream.toXML(p, new FileOutputStream("data/savedgames/"+p.getPlayerDetails().getUsername()+".xml"));
	} catch(Exception e) {
		flag = false;
	}
	return flag;
}

}
[/code]

now that i found the two files i just dont know what to change in them… help me out please, im not sure what there two “xstream” files are for.

@trilogy-reborn wrote:

before i get flamed i am new and trying to learn this stuff so i may not quite understand everything yall expect me to know but keep in mind i really want to learn to code java so i am trying i best to understand and learn what i dont understand.

i dled project awesomeness because what i decedent i wanted to try to make is a oldschool (late 2007) source with the cool new 562+ gfx.
I dont know how hard this project will be or how much i will learn while doing it but i am having troubles even getting started. All of the clients/ sources i dl are not working or not even close to what i am looking for and i think this one may work when i get it going.
what happens is i run source than rune the client and the client pops up loading bar says “server is offline if suck here”. i searched that in the files and also searched sj5connect in the files and found the spot in the coding where it says that but i am not sure what to change with it.
